alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Camden; Gloucester; Northwestern Burlington; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Atlantic, Camden, Gloucester and southern Burlington Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Evesham to near Lindenwold to Gibbstown. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deptford, Voorhees, West Deptford, Glassboro, Lindenwold, Hammonton, Woodbury, Pitman, Clayton, Berlin, Shamong, Paulsboro, Woodbury Heights, National Park, Chesilhurst, Newfield, Franklinville, Sicklerville, Atsion and Atco. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 16 and 23. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 26 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic; Camden; Gloucester; Northwestern Burlington; Southeastern Burlington
